newsitem.title: USA: UtiliCorp Mo. unit asks for power rate rise.
newsitem.headline: UtiliCorp Mo. unit asks for power rate rise.

text.p: UtiliCorp United Inc division Missouri Public Service said it has filed for a $13.2 million increase in electric rates and outlined future actions for a long-term reduction in rates.

Missouri Public said the increase, its first request for a rate rise since 1993, is designed to recover inflationary and other cost increases, including the investment of about $20 million in plant and facility improvements.

The company said in a statement it has also asked the Public Service Commission of Missouri for a $0.0028 per kilowatt-hour surcharge to cover costs related to the transition to a competitive marketplace.

Missouri Public said two elements were key to the transition to electricity competition, including the adoption of a performance-based model for determining the cost of energy to the consumer, and the separating of rates and charges on energy bills in a common sense manner.
Missouri Public Service serves 190,000 electric and 45,000 natural gas customers in western Missouri.
